name: MOSila
short_description:
MOSila aims to be a retargetable, Multi Machine (Simple) Operating System for computers based on 6502, Z80 and (perhaps) other 8 bit processors with soft interrupt capabilities.

Mainly targeted for the TK-2000 Color Computer (an expanded brazilian clone from the Multitech's Micro Professor II), it provides device independency for mass storage I/P, simple file handling and minimal memory management. An Apple II+ port will be always guaranteed, an ProDOS hosted version for the Apple //e is in the Road Map.

Binary compatibility is (somewhat, due differences between the host machines) guaranteed for 6502 code for older programs (or even older versions, if newer functionalities are not used).

Interface stability is guaranteed for previous versions (older programs will run on newer versions and vice versa if only older functionalities are used).

Architecture inspired by Acorn's MOS.
summary: A "Retargetable" Operating System for 65xx and others 8 bit computers
